intro: Senecio yauyensis, commonly known as the Yauyénsis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Senecio yauyensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its harsh, high-altitude environment.
